poem:
### The Threshold

On the brink—  
policies tally,  
their weight pressing down  
like unseasoned snow;  
  
pensioners, frozen  
in forgotten rooms,  
children beneath a sky  
of distant hope,  
  
and students—  
hunched with debt,  
climb steeper hills,  
stretch thin across time—  
  
a call  
for warmth,  
for breaking  
this biting edge.
